ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Envelope is an historical record of the transmission of a . It is used to record the audit data for sending and acknowledging a . Because it is an historical record, each Envelope is only used once, and so is not versioned.

the acknowledge attribute is used to ask for and provide acknowledgement of receipt of the Envelope. On transmission of a acknowledge shall take one of the values "" (blank), "ask message arrival" or "ask message read". A blank value expects no reply. A value of "ask message arrival" asks if the arrived at the recepients' mailbox, and requires the reply Envelope to have values "acknowledge arrival" if the arrives at the destination, or "delivery failure" if failure of the delivery is detected. Envelope is used to provide an audit trail. There is no assumption that the transmission system has any knowledge of Envelope or its usage. However, if it reports some failure, this can then be recorded in the way described. A value of "ask message read" asks if the recipient has actually opened the to read it, and expects the reply "acknowledge read" on success, or "contents corrupt" if it is not possible to for it to be read.
For any single Envelope, there should be an acknowledgement per recipient. The acknowledgement will not contain a .
The Envelope being acknowledged is referenced using an .

an identifier for the Envelope. The id is used to identify which Envelope an acknowledgement is referring to. While this needs to be unique, the scope of uniqueness is problematic, since, for example, the scope may be all the NATO defence organisations and their suppliers.
